meanings.definition: To exaggerate or overemphasize something in a performance or situation.
meanings.sent1: She kept overplaying her emotions in the play, making it seem unrealistic.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overplay his excitement whenever he wins a game.
meanings.sent3: The actor was overplaying his fear so much that it became comical.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overplay her strengths ended up costing her the role.
meanings.sent5: By overplaying his role, he unintentionally stole the spotlight from the main actor.

meanings.definition: To play a musical instrument too loudly or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The drummer was overplaying the cymbals, drowning out the rest of the band.
meanings.sent2: She realized she was overplaying the piano when the neighbors complained about the noise.
meanings.sent3: The guitarist was overplaying the strings, causing a cacophony of sound.
meanings.sent4: The violinist was overplaying her instrument, creating a jarring effect on the audience.
meanings.sent5: By overplaying the trumpet, he added an unexpected intensity to the jazz performance.

meanings.definition: To exceed the proper limits or boundaries in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: The team risked overplaying their strategies, leaving them vulnerable to counterattacks.
meanings.sent2: He was accused of overplaying his moves in the chess tournament, leading to his defeat.
meanings.sent3: The player's overplaying of the rules resulted in a penalty for the team.
meanings.sent4: By overplaying their physical abilities, the athletes ended up exhausted before the final round.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned against overplaying their strengths and advised a more balanced approach to the game.
